reviewTitle: Dull blades!  No returns! Don't buy!
reviewDescription: You cannot return this item!  Side by side comparison of Mach 3 (left) and the Amazon rip off (right).  I have used the Mach 3 for years and is a good standard, but feels expensive sometimes.  I decided to try the Amazon three blade.  The first shave was okay, pretty clean, did not grab hairs.  ONE DAY LATER, it is a rough shave, misses some of the hairs closer to the skin needing multiple strokes and grabs hairs frequently.  The amazon also leaves a goo on your skin afterwards.  Normally I don't mind trying Amazon items, because there is normally a good return policy when something is garbage, not for this razor.  Make up your own mind, but I highly recommend not buying one of the big packs, like I did, thinking you are getting a deal on a Mach 3.  Look at the pictures and make your own mind up.

I've been shaving since the wee age of 13. 45 years of shaving under my belt.I have to say that this is by far the worst razor I've ever used. The shave is not close and after a couple of uses, the blade is shot.I misplaced the handle today and had to use an old Schick Hydro I had laying around. The blade on that probably has a minimum 20 shaves on it. It was easier on my face with a closer shave than the Amazon razor.I had to dry shave years back in basic training. This razor brings back those memories. If you have a thick beard, this one is going to tear you up. I'm done with it. Back to the Hydro for me.

reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY - 1) does not work, 2) NON-RETURNABLE
reviewDescription: The shaver head on this razor is HUGE, making it impossible to shave in the smaller spaces like right under your nose.  My Gilette razor works just fine (also three blades, but the shaver head is a fraction of the size of this one), so I ended up needing to use two razors to do the job.  Second, this one is over-lubricated - it has trouble catching hairs, just glides over them instead, regardless of direction.FINALLY, THIS ITEM IS NON-RETURNABLE, so if you have the same experience as me, you're stuck with it.

reviewTitle: I would rather scrape a rusty hatchet across my face.
reviewDescription: These are quite possibly the worst shaving experience I have ever had. Not only are the blades dull right out of the package, they are at the wrong angle. Guaranteed to leave you face looking like you stuck it in a box with 3 pissed off cats, bloody and scratched. It's like they made them so awful on purpose.They should come with a free Septic pencil and a box of Gauze

Razor blades have gotten absurdly expensive.  For the longest time I have used the Gillette Mach 3 system.  And that has given me the most comfortable and satisfying shave.  But, at @ $33 for 15 Gillette cartridges, I decided to give Amazon’s three blade shaving system a try.  It was about half the price for the handle and 16 cartridges.  The worst shaving experience I have ever had.  The blades are so narrow that they flex far too much.  I have to go over the shaved area several times and it just doesn’t remove all the hair.  It’s uncomfortable.  It pulls.  And the design of the razor or razor blades head is too bulky that you can not get a close shave around and under the nose area.  Complete waste of money!

I hate to throw shade but these Amazon essential blades are a far cry from a good sharp blade(s). I don’t have a thick beard either. Just a poor economical set of blades.  Disappointed as i was hoping to find blades at a reasonable price that would do a good job. I’d of returned them but already used one out of the pack.
I would love to try them. Although the package says "compare with Mach 3", but doesn't fit Mach 3, ......so I guess I'm getting a new razor too!

LOL.  I had been using the Equate brand with low cost substitutes for Gillette Mach 3 blades.  Then I purchased these.  The blades last me about a week vs. 2-3 weeks.  Fair, they are less expensive by about 2.5 x.  But the handle and attachment system are maddening.  Clearly Gillette has some good patent protection in their super easy to use connector.
I ordered these for my son and I but they only came with the two blade refills which won’t work for our coarse hair.

The worst razors I've ever used. Impossible to change blades, the shave is not close at all because it doesn't shave you, the blades are so dull it just rips the whiskers off your face. You might as well buy a roll of duct tape and pull your beard off with it.

reviewTitle: Unfortunately, not as good as Gillette's Mach 3
reviewDescription: I generally am a fan of Amazon Basics. For the products I've tried in the past, they generally are as good as the branded version and at a much better price point. I'm sorry to say this is not the case with the 3-blade system Amazon sells. I can easily afford the Gillette blades, but their price has increased so much lately, it felt like they were taking advantage. So, I decided to try Amazon's alternative. When I unboxed it and saw that the cartridge looked very similar to Gillette's Mach 3, I was optimistic. However, after just one shave, I could tell it was inferior. Since then, I have have shaved twice, using Gillette on one side of my face and Amazon on the other, I can confidently say that the Gillette Mach 3 gives a much closer shave even with less pressure. The only other significant difference is the razor handle is a bit wider in diameter than Gillette's razor. While I don't like it quite as much, I could have gotten used to it. On a scale of 1-10 (where 10 is best and 1 is worst), I would rate Gillette's Mach 3 a "9" and Amazon Basics a "4." Conclusion: If you want to avoid the ridiculously high prices of Gillette's Mach 3, you should perhaps look elsewhere first.

reviewTitle: Don't rely on close shaves, just enough to get the job done
reviewDescription: I usually get my blades from your standard big shop store and I tend to gravitate with one brand or the other. I figured I give these a try since the reviews were generally high.I will say they work great on sensitive skin, but I feel it doesn't come close to a "clean shave".With name brand ones designed for sensitive skin, they get close enough to provide a smooth shave. With these, not so much. I figured it was one blade slightly defective but I've replaced the blades now twice and still the same.If you need something to get the job done while keeping your sensitive face well, then get these, but I personally wouldn't recommend these.You are better off purchasing one of the other name branded ones.

I’ve been using 2-blade razors for years, and the good-quality refills are getting harder to find, especially at reasonable prices. I never believed the 3, 4, or 5 blade razors would really be any better, and are more expensive. They always seemed like nothing more than manufacturers’ marketing teams hard at work to get you to spend more $ per razor refill, increasing their profits (I can say that with 40 years in marketing). When I found this 3-blade model from Amazon at reasonable kit and refill price point and generally excellent reviews, I decided to try it.After about a week of using it daily, I have to say it comes up short in most ways. On the positive side, the handle is a great design -  nice heft, and ergonomic? It handles well, and sets the expectation of a good outcome. However, the blades have already gone dull enough to not shave well - and I don’t have a thick or heavy beard. Just average. With my 2-blade brand, I’d still get at least a few more days out of it if not another full week.I wouldn’t say the shave is really any better. In fact I’d say it’s not as good from the start. Using it the exact same way as my 2-blade, it leaves areas only partially shaved. And as the week progressed that got worse as it got duller. I don’t like the way the thing tugs at my skin and beard, either. If it did a better job, I’d say that function maybe contributed to a better result. But it doesn’t.I’m glad I kept my old 2-blade razor. I’m going to trade off between them over the next couple of months to get a good comparison, but so far I’m guessing I won’t be buying more of these.

I'm tired of the high prices of my normal razor brand so I thought I would try these based on the reviews. The handle is heavy and well made, but the blades feel like they are ripping the hairs out instead of cutting them. I know it isn't because I'm still stubbly. Unfortunately I just missed the return window.

I give this two stars because it is inexpensive while being easy to handle and providing a decent shave on its first use.  After using these for awhile I certainly will not buy them again. I actually have Bic single blade razors that shave better after DOZENS of uses than these do on their second use. I can't imagine anyone using a razor just once and I have been able to use most razors 6 times or more before needing to discard them, and I dry shave often! As stated previously, I have Bic single blade razors, I bought for an unscheduled road trip, that I have had for over a year, used many times, haven't shown any signs of rust, and still shave reasonably well.  Much of my body gets shaved and so far I end up using the months old Bic razor to do the first basic shave and then use this for the final shave. If I used them for the full shave they would have to be discarded after that. Other razors might be more expensive, but they shave much better, last longer, are easier to use, and have a better design that gets the smaller curves areas easier (such as the jaw line).  You're almost better off with cheap single or dual blade razors which come packed in a plastic bag than to spend any money on these. Even in a pinch they really aren't worth it.
Seems to lose sharpness after first use. Liked the 5 blade version better. Would return and exchange if return window had not passed

I grew my hair for 5 days because I don't shave my head every day and the mach 3 still works perfectly regardless so I was looking for something that could do the same without the ridiculous price but this is just another failure. The "anticlog" feature is false. They do rinse out easily but they clog quickly so it took much too long with multiple passes required.

reviewTitle: Quality of materials is lacking unfortunately...
reviewDescription: This review just comes out of some user experience using the handle (or gripping mechanism that clamps to the Amazon Basics Razer) as it ended up prematurely breaking off after a few cartridges of use.The razers themselves are fairly decent for near one time usages, as having used a variety of other razers near this price point like Gillette, Harry, and BIC for example, these razors are the best they just get the job done however, as a person an issue for most people that shave their face everyday, even after using after shave it's pretty easy for the onset of breaking out to occur. This was infrequent with this razor, however I wasn't able to get extensive use for it outside of using just to handful of cartridges before the stem, or the mechanism that holds the razor broke prematurely unfortunately.Just throwing this out is like a "hey this can happen" forewarning to anyone that's kind of on the fence about this razor!

reviewTitle: Perfect fit with CVS pharmacy 5 blades:)
reviewDescription: Update:  The blades suck from the first shave, then decline after. Oh well, at least I can use the CVS pharmacy 5 blades. Those are cheaper than Gillette, but the quality is about the same.Noticed CVS pharmacy 5 blade cartridges fit this. Those are excellent on this machine. I like the 2-d swivel. Will update when I try the Amazon blades on it.
Stay away from these razors, tried to get a refund

reviewTitle: Smooth... soft legs, in a fresh clean bed. HEAVEN!  BUTTT.....
reviewDescription: Let me start by saying I've been a loyal user of Amazon razors for years, and they've been my go-to choice for a reason. The 5-blade razors, in particular, have been my holy grail, providing the smoothest, most comfortable shave I've ever experienced. Each replacement head lasts me well over a month, even with daily touch-ups and every other day shaving. I couldn't ask for more in terms of quality and longevity.A Slip in Attention:However, this time, I admit I didn't pay close attention while ordering, and I ended up with the 3-blade version instead of my beloved 5-blade razors. It was a classic case of my own oversight, and I'm kicking myself for not reading the listing more carefully. The 3-blade razors, while undoubtedly functional, just don't match the smoothness and precision I'm used to with the 5-blade razors.Personal Preference:I want to be clear; my slightly lower rating is purely due to my personal preference. The 3-blade razors are not bad by any means; they just don't align with my shaving habits and skin sensitivity as well as the 5-blade ones do. I find them a bit rougher on my skin, which is something I hadn't experienced with the 5-blade version.A Note to Fellow Shavers:So, here's a friendly reminder for fellow shavers: make sure to double-check the specifications and choose the razor that suits your preference best. Whether you're a fan of 3 blades or 5, Amazon razors are undeniably top-notch in terms of quality, sharpness, and durability. It's just a matter of what works best for your skin and shaving routine.Conclusion:In conclusion, Amazon razors are fantastic, and my experience with the 3-blade version hasn't changed that. While I might have a temporary mismatch in my shaving routine, I can confidently say that these razors, regardless of the blade count, are worth the investment. So, whether you're a meticulous reader like me or occasionally overlook details, rest assured that Amazon razors deliver quality, even if you accidentally end up with a version that doesn't align perfectly with your preferences. Here's to smooth shaving, no matter the blade count!

Back in the 90s I bought the Gilette Sensor, the first in an onslaught of ever-more-expensive and increasingly multi-bladed razors.  It worked well enough, so I never jumped on the cash-vacuum bandwagon of Mach this or that next newest razor system.  Between the Sensor and electric razors I’ve been more or less good for about 30 years.  Problems: electric never got as good a shave, and the sensor was always hard to rinse out during use—blades too close to the edges or something.  This new razor is a great improvement, as I’m sure many of those higher priced would have been if I had tried them.  It cuts close, stays sharp a long time and rinses out very easily compared to my old clogging Sensor.  Plus it was way cheaper, especially the Prime day deal I got.  I’m pleased.

Summary:  Easy to use, good quality, close shave, blades last a long time, but has a large head.Let me start by saying that I often go for long periods of time where I only shave every other day.  I am used to my expensive 5 head razers lasting 3 weeks to a month.  I have used Gillette, Schick and Harry in the past.  I have liked them all equally depending on the blade model that I buy.I bought this pack with 2 of the 5 blades, but then bought 3 blade replacement pack because I never felt like I got a closer shave with my Gillette when it went from 3 blades to 5.  It just got more expensive.This razer handle is about the same as others.  Weight, angle, etc.  It's comfortable and easy to use just as the all are.  But the head does seem to swivel better in more directions.  It gives a very close shave and although I have sensitive skin, it glides nicely and does not leave razor burn.The surprising thing...... It is now exactly 2 months since I bought it and I have not been able to try the 3 blade refills because I'm still using the first 5 blade head that came with the handle.  It came with 2.  So it will be at least another 2 months before I will be able to try and review the 3 blade version.The only negative for me is that they are very large.  There is a large area around the blades.  I have had some other brands models that do this too.  It's like a swiffer, and makes it a bit difficult to make clean lines at the sideburns and get under the nose.  I'm not sure why they do this.  But it still shaves like a dream and last such a long time that it makes the already good value even better.Some men throw their razers around or stick them in with toothbrushes and other thing where the blades get banged up.  I always  lay mine flat, blades up and very well cared for.  But these really do seem to last longer than the other brands.

These are the best razors I've ever used.  They are just as good and sharp, if not better than the top razor brands like Gillette.  The only issue I have is the head of the razor is bulky and not the greatest for precision shaving, but it's good enough.  Absolutely recommend these.  They also last as long or longer than other razor companies.  BUY BUY BUY
Easy to use, clean, and store. Handle feels good and control of the razor is sure and easy. Price is excellent.

First- I NEVER write a product review.I have been shaving my head for two years and have tried electric, several different types of safety razor blades, and Harry’s. I have trouble with razor burn and have sensitive skin. This is BY FAR the best razor for head shaving in the shower. I’m a daily shaver and will buy this from now on!!
Never thought I would give up my Venus razors but they have just been so ridiculously expensive- I switched and love saving the money and these work just fine

reviewTitle: Great price for men's shaving needs
reviewDescription: I love that these work as well as some of the top brands.  The price is great and I get almost a month per blade.
Quality is decent cuts great. About 2 to 3 shaves then change blade

I've been shaving my head and face together, for about 15 years. I've tried every razor and electric head shaver under the sun. The electric head shavers just don't get as close as a blade. After it became more difficult to find my go to "careone" razors at Riteaid pharmacy, I decided to give these a try. I thought the careones were the best razor I had found. These far surpass the quality of shave I get with those! If you shave your head like I do, you know you usually have to make multiple passes to get all of the stubble. With this razor, usually a single pass gets the hair, leading to less irritation on the skin! I highly recommend giving these a shot!
Only lasts maybe 2 shaves before I felt like it was pulling.  Definitely not as good as some of your normal brand name razors.

reviewTitle: Cheap, but you get what you pay for
reviewDescription: I was looking for an option to my existing Hydro 5 because the refill prices are painful. Ordered this set to try out after reading all of the reviews. I'm not at all impressed with this razor. After one shave the blades are already dull. I normally shave twice a week, and during the second shave I could already feel dullness and pulling and missed spots. I guess I'll be keeping this as a back up travel razor, but I won't be reordering.

reviewTitle: The blades are kinda ok but razor handle horrible
reviewDescription: Razors were definitely bargain brand ... But got a lot of them so was ok.  But the razor handle is horrible.  Can't shave certain areas like jiat under my nose bc the handle gets in the way.  It holds the razor at an odd angle or something and is too bulky around the head of the razor.  I wouldn't recommend

This is one of the worst  razors I ever have bought in my 42 years of shaving. I tried everything from shaving dry to shaving with water in the shower. This razor will not give me a close shave. I shave at night in shower (water only) and when I look in the morning I have day old stubble. Sorry Amazon, this is a big miss on your part. :-(

reviewTitle: If you shave everyday, might be fine. Otherwise, go with another brand.
reviewDescription: Don't be fooled by the cheap price, these blades are not for the casual shaver. If you skip several days between shaves like me, you'll be disappointed.
Had to make multiple passes to get a smooth shave.  My regular brand shaves much better.  I tried this Solomon brand to see if I could save some money.Will stay with my regular brand.

I had never heard of this brand but all of the glowing reviews had me purchase the product.  It's not a great shave - I shave in the shower and typically, when I get out in better light and see my shave I have to touch up.  I think the blades are too rigid and miss areas of my face.  I'm disappointed in this product.  You get what you pay for.  Not worth the annoyance for a deal.

Purchased for value but the actual shave left much to be desired. I shave at night and by morning it feels like a 24 a stubble already. Razor handle is comfy but blades do not shave close nor do they give desired smoothness. If I knew how I would ask for a refund!

reviewTitle: The blades just aren't hardened sufficiently
reviewDescription: If you compare these blades to typical top of the line blades, it's clear they go dull much, much faster.  Even though they are cheaper, they may not be worth it.  I'll be going back to Gillette or Schick or someone who makes a longer lasting blade.

The ones that came with the razor worked well so I decided to buy some refills. These refills were dull and pulled my hair by the third shave, nowhere near as good as the ones that came with the razor. The worse part is they are not returnable, one of the main reasons I use Amazon.

I'm 53 with a beard. I've used Gillette Sensor Excel razors for years, because the razor head would remain straight at the top and cut a straight line where I chose. I've been unlucky to find a modern alternative that swivels. This razor has a solid weight closer to my father's single blade razor. The head remains static at the top allowing for a straight cut where I choose to cut. The head swivels over the jaw and under the neck similarly to my son's very modern multi-blade razor. The price for this model is great, as a 10 pack of blades from Gillette Sensor Excel is 3x as much as this product. Pros: Weight, solid feel, apparent quality. Straight cut, adequate swivel. Price. Cons: None. I recommended this product to my son this morning!
They shave close and smooth.
Lo cómoda y afiladas

reviewTitle: nO CUTS AND NO NICKS IN GENTILE AREA
reviewDescription: This product is as good if not better than most at less money.  Great for shaving legs and below the waist area.,
Very good product for the price. Long lasting blades give a close shave over and over

reviewTitle: Been a gillette guy forever but this razor is at least as good at a fraction of the price!!
reviewDescription: Very smooth- no pull!  Guess you really don’t need 5 blades!
Calidad
Very happy with the quality for the price. I actually prefer these to the 5-blade Amazon Basics razor refills I purchased previously.
We were loyal DSC users for 5 years. Then they changed the razors so we tried these and they're great.
Super convenient 👌
Works fine and the price is very good.  No need to buy expensive name brands.  BTW, Temu has the same shaver for cheaper.
Reasonably priced and shaves well.
I'm very happy with the quality and price point.

reviewTitle: Affordable alternative and great package size
reviewDescription: My husband and I have been trying out many different shavers including subscription services, but something was always wrong. These work great for us and I love the pack size, so I don't have to think about getting refills every few weeks.

For me, it is all about the value.  How well does the item perform for the money I've paid?Well, this razor and refills has shown to be excellent.The blades are sharp and shave beautifully.The handle has some heft and is solid but the head moves effortlessly to keep the blades in contact evenly.I was lucky enough to try these under a sale, so the price was fantastic (even the regular price is very, very good).I definitely recommend these razors & refills and hope Amazon stays with the same manufacturer!
These are so much better that the new Club Series razors from Dollar Shave Club.....They stay sharp much longer and shave closer.....and cost less.....

reviewTitle: More reliable than Dollar Shave Club.
reviewDescription: It’s a solid razor. Is it better than Gillette, Schick, Dollar Shave Club, and Harry’s? I don’t know. I used Dollar Shave Club for a couple of years. Was tired of the hassle of keeping up with the subscription, but more importantly, was tired of a shipment going missing, then having the customer service rep act like it was probably your fault. When I quit, and there was a survey asking why, there was even an option to say you didn’t receive your order. That’s messed up. Realized that Amazon had a similar program. Three blade razor. Works the same as the other razor. Price was about the same as the other razor. And more importantly, you get Amazon’s reliability when you place an order. Instead of waiting if it will arrive, it’s there the next day. And if you want, you can just put in on Subscribe and Save and it’ll automatically ship on a 1 to 6 month schedule.
A great shave,ease of handling to shave. Blades last a long time.Cleans with ease.
I dont need 5 blades with my light beard, waste of $, but thats what i been using for decades. So i went w the 3 blade, just as good, lower price.

I shave my head and face about every other day so I put razors through their paces.  It's getting harder to find decent 3-blade razors in the store and the 5s don't work for me as they gum up quickly.These are inexpensive, last a good while, the handle is very easy to maneuver, and unlike disposables I haven't nicked myself even once.  No razor burn either.  Highly recommended.
These blades cut me twice in one shave - I’ve been using a razor for 20+ years so I’m not a noviceStay away these are not even close to a quality razor
Too much drag on skin in sensitive areas. The blades did not glide on my skin. I use a quality shave cream and even with the lubricating strips, this blade does not measure up.

reviewTitle: You pay for what you get
reviewDescription: The blades are not that sharp. In fact, it is very uncomfortable shaving with these blades. I switched from DSC thinking I'd be saving money but I'm going back with DSC after these.
These do not last long between shaves.  After two or three shaves, they are rough on my face.  I will pay a little more for a better shaver.
This is my second time ordering these blades; the first time I ordered the razor with blades. These were not as good as the ones I bought originally. Not a good close shave.

reviewTitle: Not so good for a heavy beard
reviewDescription: With a heavy beard these blades are effective for about three shaves, maybe four. The disposable version is much better for me.

reviewTitle: The blade is good, the engineering not so much.
reviewDescription: The razor 🪒 shaves ok but the way it is designed does not work. Just not engineed correctly.
If you are not interested in a close shave this razor is ok but it takes some effort to get a smooth shave.  I'm not interested in buying this again.

This item is right-priced but has an odd “gummy” moisturizing strip that is sticky when wet and strings between the razor and your skin.  There’s also no single blade on the back for touch ups like Gillette’s version.
The price is good. Not as close a shave as Gillette nor as long lasting.

I usually buy Gillette but decided to try these ones. I regret my decision as these razors dull quickly. I only get 1-3 shaves before the blades have dulled and it takes a very long time to shave. The comfort strip does not make a noticeable difference in shaving ease. I am a woman and found these worse than pink razors.

Ever since new the blade handle will not firmly grip a blade.Now the handle no longer holds a blade rendering the system ineffective.This seems like a deal, but functions poorly.I’ll stick with Mach 3
They don't really cut close as you would think
The amount of blades you receive are plenty, the handle is comfortable. However the blades are horrible.  Do not shave well at all, easily get packed with shaved hairs and must be cleaned constantly.

reviewTitle: The best a guy can get.....sort of
reviewDescription: Way better than expected. They last as long or a little longer than top two famous brands. Easy to hold handle. Hard to load a new blade cartridge for this old guy. So tired of overpaying for razor blades- so I’ll continue to use these.

The main blades work well but the single blade for use on sideburns is awful!  The main blade won’t fit under my nose.  It pull the whiskers (brand new nine you).  Also nicked my cheek with the corner edge.  Not good.

reviewTitle: Does not give a close shave
reviewDescription: Cuts whiskers,  but shave is far from close

These 3blades carts. don't work well. I have experienced more nicks than with any dollar -store razor over a five year period. I guess I need to go back to the dollar store. Thought about trying the 5-blade cart, but decided not to chance it.

Bought this because the reviews compared it to the Gillette fusion. Lmao. Not even close. It doesn't work even half as well and leaves me with INSANE Ingrown hairs like I haven't had in years, disappointed

reviewTitle: Not the razor’s I needed or wanted
reviewDescription: I wanted and needed five blade razors.  These were totally useless, and I ended up throwing them out.
Very dull blades. Spend a couple more dollars for a better brand.

Replacing my mach 3, because you know, gillette...I shave my whole head and face. While this razor did not cause any irritation, cuts, or razor burn, it was a terrible shave. I had to go over areas multiple times. Seemed to miss a lot of hairs on each pass. I'm thinking it is because if the pivoting head maybe?  It took me several minutes longer to shave than usual. Bottom line - the hassle is not worth the price.

They do not shave very well. Lube strip does nothing. Hard to attach to handle. Trying to find replacement for mail order blade, these were good price. Good enough to finish using what I bought but will change once they are gone.

Bought this razor a few months ago and never got around to trying it since I had so many blades for Harry's. Well I finally tried it and it was very uncomfortable. It certainly didn't glide smoothly and left my face irritated. Would not recommend this razor.
Didn't shave very lose.
not a comfortable shave, made cheaply would spend a few bucks more for a better blade and razor
Not a very good shave.  And you can't return it
Handle is well balanced, but the blades are terrible

These aren’t great and not worth the cheap price. I am a girl but always use men’s razors for my legs. These we’re good for the very first use of a new razor but then just didn’t work well at all. Plus they caused red bumps and a rash all over my legs. Not sure why.

reviewTitle: This razor wears down too easily Have to make serveral passes to trim
reviewDescription: I am a female I just thought that this would work better than other blades cause its intinally made for the beard of a very scruffy tough bearded man ..I am wasn't really impressed ,and my boyfriend wasnt too enthused about it either.

I have been using Jack Black razors. I want to spend less money so I tried these and they are just fine, and cost a lot less. Are they would I would say they are only slightly not quite as good but more than good enough. Very pleased.
Just as good as a well know razor I’ve used for years.

reviewTitle: They work just as good as the expensive one if ask me.
reviewDescription: I have tried many brands and shave everyday and am always looking to save money. This has hit the mark for me. For the price, I can use a new one everyday if needed but I choose to use them for about three days and then switch to new.

Do you like the Mach 3, but don't like either Gillette or the price?  Then this is the razor system for you.  Shaves better than a Mach 3 for a fraction of the price.  Don't believe me?  Spend the $6-ish and try it for yourself.  I really don't think that you'll be unhappy that you did.

reviewTitle: Don't hesitate they're more than worth it.
reviewDescription: These are my Impressions after my first use.. Let me just say that I have been using crappy generic disposable razors recently because I've been leery to invest in a shaving system. Mainly because most of the blades are ridiculously expensive and there seems to be a new one every month making the old one obsolete. I decided to pull the trigger on this because I couldn't beat the price. I have a beard and only shave my neck, cheeks and mustache, which I do 2-3 times a week tops. So I figured with as little as I shave these will last me three years and by that point I think my $15 investment is well worth 3 years worth of shaving even if eventually they stop making these blades.So I ran out of the cheap disposable razors and I hadn't shaved in about a week so I was getting pretty scruffy. Usually when I get to this point I'll take my electric clippers and trim it down as short as it'll go before I actually shave. Just to save some wear and tear on my face and honestly those cheap disposable razors just couldn't handle it otherwise. Well I wanted to put this new system to the test so I decided not to do that and I just shaved fresh out of the shower with a week of stubble. All I can say is wow! This thing went through my beard like a hot knife through butter. Made me feel kind of dumb that I kept wasting money on those cheap disposable razors recently. I have no nicks, there was no pulling and it took it off with very minimal strokes. If you're on the fence about these I would say go for it, they are awesome and where else are you going to get a decent shave for less than $1per blade?

reviewTitle: As good as all the name brands
reviewDescription: I wasn't sure what to expect from these blades but I'll have to say they are every bit as good as any of the name brand blades I have ever used.
I personally like these razors because of the longevity and close shaves.

Easy to load cartridges into this razor handle. The handle shape makes use a breeze. Each cartridge lasts about a week. I prefer the three blade cartridges to the 5 or more blades sometimes packed into the cartridge. Three blade cartridges are easier to navigate.
good blades and way cheaper than those name brands

reviewTitle: it cuts close and it’s sharpe best shave i’ve had in a while i’m impressed
reviewDescription: i don’t have any complaints , it cuts clean and fast very sharpe good shve
Price is good. But quality not so much.  Only last one shave or two.  Value for money Gillette is much better.
These razors are of poor quality and very hard to get a close shave without putting excessive pressure on your face.

reviewTitle: The cartridge is to big for the number of blades
reviewDescription: This product has razor cartridges that are better suited for four(4) or five(5) blades not three(3). It is hard to edge your side burns or mustache with these razor cartridges. Also, the handle allows too much articulation (play, flex, movement) of the cartridge. You may have had a better experience with this product unfortunately I did not. I bought the kit with 20 cartridges, big mistake. I will NOT be buying this product again.

reviewTitle: I was disappointed with this razor
reviewDescription: I didn’t like the 3-blade razor. My last razor I used wad a 5-blade so I’m going to try the 5blade from Amazon to compare. This 3-blade I feel doesn’t cut very well and feels like I can’t even shave once without feeling like it’s not sharp enough to do a good job.

reviewTitle: You  get what your pay for
reviewDescription: I hate the "20 blade super shave" at $5 a cartridge trend in shaving.  These were perfect. Three blades and Super Super affordable. The first shave was incredible. Smooth and very very sharp. The second shave not so much. The third was awful, and I had to grab the old razor to get the finish  I wanted. The 2nd cartridge was the same performance.  Even at their price point, a new cartridge every other day is the same price as my others.I wanted to love them, but I can't.
Single use cartridge as it dulls quickly

reviewTitle: Better if it would remove facial hair.
reviewDescription: Used single blade razors from the big warehouse for years. Thought I would move up to these based on the reviews. Problem is the Basic 3 blades don't remove facial hair nearly as well as the cheap ones. And don't last as long before pulling starts. Going back on this one.

reviewTitle: Not the greatest, not the worst.
reviewDescription: Pretty mediocre razors. Not as close of a shave as I would've liked. I tried these after dumping Harry's and DSC. Both of those brands were better quality, in retrospect. These are less expensive for a reason. Three blade edges are less costly to produce, but once you've experienced a shave with 4 or more blades on the cartridge, you simply can't settle for less. I won't be trying them again.

reviewTitle: Does not give you the same quality shave as the name brand
reviewDescription: I have always used the Gillette Mach 3 Turbo as my razor of choice, however, like many, I got tired of paying their crazy prices for blades and wanted to try Amazon's brand, which with the razors and handle, are a fraction of the price of the name brand.  While they are not terrible, they seem to require way more razor strokes than the Mach 3 and I still do not get as close of a shave.  It feels like the cartridge design does not allows the blades to connect to my face as well as the Mach 3's.  Overall, the poorer shaving experience is not worth the cost savings.  I will be going back to the better designed Mach 3.
I changed to the Amazon Basics 5 blade razor and like it much better.

reviewTitle: Not sharp at all one refill per shave if you're lucky
reviewDescription: Has anyone at Amazon quality control tried these? Very dull blades, will not cut on a down stroke only an up stroke and only after 2 or 3 passes. Can't use more than once, need a fresh refill each shave. Spend a few dollars more and get a name brand, not worth it at all. I will not buy again

reviewTitle: You Get What You Pay For
reviewDescription: The handle is decent with enough heft to feel of substance.  The blades are TERRIBLE!  The blades themselves are not even relative to the frame so on any given stroke, only a small portion of the blades contact your face.  I was never able to get a complete close shave and went back to my old dull razor to finish up.  Probably worth mentioning I tried with two different blades and had the same issue.  Look elsewhere if you are trying to find an economical razor.

I'm always looking for a budget alternative to the expensive name-brand razors and having had good experiences with other Amazon branded items decided to give these try. I was disappointed and won't be buying them again. They were rough on my face and the shave was inconsistent with my tough beard and would leave patches of stubble. If you want to order a budget razor from Amazon, the Dorco razors are a great option.

This razor gives a terrible shave.  I used two of the blades thinking one might have been defective.  After I shave and shave again,  I feel stubble in all the areas that I shaved as compared with my former razor where my skin felt smooth.  I would not recommend this product and throwing away the remaining blades and returning to my old blades and razor.

reviewTitle: The first Amazon-branded product I wasn't thrilled with
reviewDescription: Too late to return.  I gave it two month's worth of tries, but every single shave was pitiful.  Maybe it's just me?  Going back to the expensive brands - never had a bad shave with any of those in my entire life.

reviewTitle: Blades R Gr8 the handle is terrible
reviewDescription: I really liked the blades but the handle is total crap.  I struggled to attach a new razor head darn near every time.  Finally today, after 5 attempts to attach a new razor with no luck I threw it all away in disgust.  Do not spend your money on this product unless you love being frustrated first thing in the morning.  I'm surprised because I haven't had any problem with items I have purchased from Amazon but this time they dropped the ball.
one word BAD

reviewTitle: Just ok not reliable clean cut
reviewDescription: Misses a lot when shaving not the clean cut I expect like other razors I’ve tried. Will go back to dsc

I've been using dollar store single blade razors (Bic) 5 pack for 1.69 that work well. I decided to try and upgrade to 3 blade amazon type. With three blades it should do better but did not. It was like shaving with tweezers pulling at your face. Not even a close shave as I had to go over my face over 4 or 5 times to get a close shave. My cheap single dollar store blade blow these away. Waste of time.
Blades feel dull and pull your whiskers.Tried 3 different razor blades and all felt dull and irritated skin.

reviewTitle: Dull right out of the box
reviewDescription: Looked like a good deal to replace the expensive Gillette razors, but these are as dull out of the box as a two month old Gillette razor. Useless

reviewTitle: Doesn't do what it was made for
reviewDescription: Usually don't write reviews, but was very dissatisfied with this product.  I have to go over the same area of my face several times in different directions trying to get this thing to do what it was made do to.  It feels like decent quality in your hands, but when something doesn't do what it was made for, then what's the use of it?  I guess it would make a good paper weight.

I got one of these to replace an old gilette mark 3. The blades were crap. Drag, pull and tug. NO way would be go 2 days without shaving with this stuff...ITS CHEAP PRICE and even cheaper blades...total waste of money

The 3-blade razors don't work very well. I tried ordering the 5-blade, but ordered the 3-blade by mistake. Went to return it, and it says not returnable. The return policy is the reason I buy from Amazon. I do not recommend this product.CHECK THE RETURN POLICY FOR ANYTHING YOU BUY ON AMAZON FRIENDS!

The space between the blades and the edge of the head is too wide to get into tight spaces (ie under the nose, side burns, etc.) so I have to use my old razor for those space.  I will not be using after this batch of blades.
This does not compare to Mach 3.  Do not recommend

I had to make sure the blade was on correctly, as it was severely lacking any ability to shave. It's almost as bad as the electric razor that I use, but at least the electric razor cuts some of the hair. The blade on this thing barely does anything for my beard. I was really hoping for a better outcome, to help reduce the cost. But no luck, this is worthless. At least I only wasted a few dollars.
The blades do not cut the facial hair effectively at all. I do not recommend this product at all.
Great Affordable Blades!

reviewTitle: Worthless waste wouldn’t shave a whisker off a watermelon
reviewDescription: Three blades can’t get through my five o’clock shadow without multiple passes, and plenty of cheap single blade disposables have done three times the job for a third of the price; also, how do people shave under their nose with these monsters? I got a couple of nicks on smooth skin... these are just terribly made blades. SKIP THIS PRODUCT.
Handle broke pretty quick. The blades are also not great quality- narrow and you have to go over spots several times to get a smooth shave.
Does not give a close clean shave!!

When I had seen the first picture of the box that these "Compare to Mach3", I assumed they would fit on a Mach3 handle. They do not. Come to find out, you have to read the Q&A at the bottom of the listing to see they fit on a Solimo handle.Now it's time to see if it's easier buying one than returning these.

I don't know if they'll even post my review because it's negative (even though it's entirely accurate) but here we go. I opened the package and it LOOKS nice, don't get me wrong. For $6 it appears as though you're getting a quality product but that's all it is, smoke and mirrors. I exfoliated, lathered up my limb with foamy soap and made the razor do it's thing. Only it didn't do the thing, my extremity was still hairy and the "razor" took off maybe 10% of my hair? I went over the section again and again, pressing harder until it started to feel uncomfortable. Nothing. Don't waste your time. Don't waste your money. You can't even RETURN A DEFECTIVE PRODUCT. I know it's cheap but I basically feel like I had my money stolen from me.

This is the poorest razor and blades I've ever used. I'll scrape my face with it showering, and I see that beard crumbs are indeed falling off of me as expected, but when I check my face,  next to nothing has been removed. I have to give up because you can only do so much razor-surgery before your face gets too raw to continue. It takes that amount of working before I'm somewhat shaved. Kind of hard to believe that in the year 2000, and Twenty-One 🙄, someone like this are making razor/blade sets which can't shave a face.We'd may as well get used to this sort of thing, as the flat-earth, "post-Middle Ages pain management technology is a BAD thing"🤔 generation take over everything.

I was hopeful that this would be an average razor set at a little better price. It is poor. The razors do not shave remotely close. I have a shave like Homer right after shaving. They do not stay sharp for more than one shave. The blades are very difficult to change, I have not experienced such difficulty in 35 years of shaving. The handle is heavy. Not good news quality. Sometimes it takes 2 or 3 of the blades to shave, they dull very quickly.

My beard has always been tough. Now that's it grey it's even tougher. I had been using regular double sided thin blades. They really only worked once, but were cheap. Then I switched to Harry's, which was great for maybe 2 shaves, but expensive. I thought I'd try these. I was disappointed, my face burns. These remind me of the cheap plastic razors you find at the dollar store or grocery store. Even the first shave was hard, and hurt. If your beard is thick and tough these razors might not cut it.

This was my first time ordering Amazon brand razors. I order four blade with my normal brand. The three blade has a gap on both sides of the blades. See picture. I ordered a set of the five blade and was much more pleased with my purchase.

reviewTitle: Not bad, but should have went for the 5 blade
reviewDescription: Update: the more I use these the more I hate them.  They deposit hair clippings all over ny face and I can never get a close shave around my lips and nose.  This is a hard no for me.Original review: This was ok, but did not get as close as I hoped.  I thought I purchased the 5 blade ones.  I will try those next time.

Thought I’d give Amazon’s 3 blade option a try after using another economy 3 blade for years. The razors themselves are trash and dull very quickly. 3 months in, the handle broke and no longer will hold blades. Avoid, there are better options
I shave my head every day and this blade is the one I've found that does it well. I only cut myself if I go too fast and get my other hand! I have these  stored up so I don't run out.

reviewTitle: Just as good as the name brands.
reviewDescription: Good quality for the amount works just as well as the name brands.
affordable and worth it
Good dog.

reviewTitle: Great for those that loved the Kirkland razors
reviewDescription: Husband used the 3 blade Kirkland razors before Costco stopped selling them.  He really enjoys using these, but he does need to replace the blades more frequently.
Great private label product IF used with compatable AMAZON razor blade holder.

reviewTitle: Was skeptical but great choice for men’s razor
reviewDescription: My husband is very picked with his razors always had to buy the expensive Gillette ones money was tight so I got these hoping for the best my husband loves them and there 1/2 the price

reviewTitle: Razors fit on and come off handle easily
reviewDescription: Over all price for the money good, sharp,lasts for quite a few shaves
Like 3 blades cartridges even more than 5-blade ones: it's durable, works perfect on Amazon shave tool
I like the way it shaves me.  And the blades last a long time.
Blades are not very sharp, need to repeatedly go over an area to get a not so close shave.

Been using Mach 3 blades for years. Thought I would give these blades a try to save $. Not even close. I've shaved several times now thinking it will get better. Nope. Every shave I nick myself. They grip / pull the skin to much. Doesn't get a close shave like Mach 3 does. I need to use my electric shaver to get what the blade missed.Will be going back to name brand razor and spend the extra $ for better shave. Now I have a pack of 20 blades I can't return.

reviewTitle: I tried really hard to like these razor blades...
reviewDescription: As a general rule, I avoid buying Gillette products, not because they're low quality (they're not) or low value (also not) but because I recognize that a portion of every dollar sent to Gillette is used to fund the New England Patriots. I can't have that on my conscience. So when I saw that Amazon was backing a new razor manufacturer, I jumped at the opportunity. I tried really hard to like these razor blades, but I just can't. It's difficult to get the blades onto the handle. The blades look like they could fit either way. Even if you get them attached, at first it looks like you've got it backwards. The little moisturizer strip at the top of the blade is just a little too wide for me to be able to get the blade on the mustache hairs directly below my nose. I inevitably miss those hairs and I can feel them every time I exhale through my nose - that irritates me all day. Finally - and most importantly - the blades just aren't as sharp as Gillette and they dull significantly faster, leading to me having to cover the same area three or four times, irritating my skin. Please Amazon, fix these things so I can try them again!

The 3 blade razor I've been sticking with for possibly 20 years now has jumped in price yet again!!!  Amazon has a lot of house brand products that are pretty decent and a great value so I thought I would try this.  The handle itself felt exact to the quality and weight that I am used to.  I did the same prep that I am used to and the shave did not feel good at all to say the least.  No cuts, but I ended up using a blade from the previous brand.  Keep in mind I normally would have thrown out the blade I finished my shave with, but it was still better.To be honest, the shave reminded me years ago when I tried a sensitive skin version of the brand I am used to.  I don't know if the angle is changed on the sensitive skin razor or what makes them different.  I really like the price, quality of the handle, and if amazon is listening please change the angles or something.  Send me an email when you do and I will try again.

reviewTitle: Maybe I got a bad batch
reviewDescription: Was not impressed with these razors, didn't last more than a few shaves. I shave my face and head, dulled fairly quickly.
I used this product to shave my head. When I compare the brand new blades with thr Mach 3 head that I have used for several months, it was not shaving as smoothly. Stick with Mach 3.

These razors do not cut well, they just pull your hair. Also, the border around the blades is very big which makes it hard to shave with precision and get to tight spaces around the nose etc... I do not recommend these. Only good thing I can say is the price and comfort of handle, but those are not important if it can't cut hair.

reviewTitle: very difficult to load new cartridges
reviewDescription: I can only give this product two stars because of the extreme difficulty of loading new cartridges into the handle.  It requires a great deal of squinting and swearing before the handle can be properly clipped into the new cartridge, and the cartridge forced out of its plastic case.  Once the cartridge is installed, it shaves great, and the blades last a long time.  5 stars for the shave, 0 stars for the difficulty of loading new cartridges.

Hi, I read the reviews and most people were satisfied with this razor Solimo 3-blad?  Some stated however it doesn't shave close. I'm here to tell you it doesn't come close to saving close although it can pass on the first day meaning although you will feel peach fuzz as we call it the face still looks clean. On the second day no such luck.  You begin to see the visible peach fuzz left on your face. The third day using the same blade while you're shaving the peach fuzz shows because you can't get the shaving cream to shave off your face.  In short your face especially if your beard is grey like mine is visible and you can't even shave the cream off your face.  Sure it shaves smooth and you don't have to worry about cuts because the blade glides over your skin and facial hair.  Sure the razor handles well look good but that's all.  You have to be careful with reviews some people will deceive you for some secret discount or work for the company.  Here is the good news, if you change blades every day your shave will have peach fuzz but not visible to the naked eye and truly maybe that is why you get so many blades.Thank youTruth finder

The first shave with the cartridge that was already installed in the handle...I'm, this is the best shave I've ever had...finally, after a lifetime of looking for THAT razor...here it was! It was so good I got 9 or 10 shaves out of it...ok, 1st cartridge out of the sleeve...huh?...it feels like a store brand...got 3 shaves, all of them C minus...a fluke?...onto the 3rd one...does two establish a pattern?...it does for me, I mean, I got 17 more to go, if so, it was a waste of money! Now, they wouldn't load up the 1st one with an ace...and the rest with duds to take its place?...I'm hoping this is an anomaly but I'm gonna have to wait and see!

When I first saw this product offering and the awesome deal Amazon had going at the time (January 2023), I was excited. I bought two of the 21-packs, which meant I had 2 handles and 40 cartridges. The value seemed insane! And the reviews I read were overall pretty positive so I was looking forward to it.Quick backstory: I've gone through a good number of razor brands and models over the years. For whatever reason, it seemed like after I had used a particular option for a while, my shaves got worse. i.e. Dollar Shave Club was great for a long time but after a while the shaves started sucking. Similar story with Gillette Mach 3 refill cartridges, even when they came from different sources (i.e. Amazon, Costco, grocery store). Tried Gillette Mach 3 Sensitive disposables and those worked pretty good but wasteful/expensive for regular use. Then I found my way into Harry's 5-blade razors and those work great but a little too close and not sensitive enough (I think 3-blade razors are my thing). Although more expensive than I prefer, Harry's is still my preferred option over these Amazon Basics 3-blade Razors.Onto the Amazon Basics offering... overall I don't like them. The first shave is kinda rough. 2nd shave is actually "okay" and makes it seem like the blades just had to break in on the first shave. But then by the end of the 3rd shave it's dragging hard and I have to dispose of the cartridge. Also the blades seem to clog more than any razor I've used before which means it takes longer to shave. So far I've gone through ~30-35 of the Amazon Basics 3-blade refill cartridges so I'd say my assessment is fair.For my use case (decently thick beard, shave every-other-day) I wouldn't recommend these. Even getting 3 shaves per cartridge the value is still reasonable but I'm only still using them to not be wasteful.

reviewTitle: I like the weight and feel of this razor.
reviewDescription: This razor is worth the money and performs satisfactorily. I believe a 5 blade model would give you a better shave.

reviewTitle: Good not great, but still a good value
reviewDescription: Not as good as the category killer brands but functional and always a good price.  Weirdly, I have to press harder to get a close shave with these.  no nicks though.  Will go back to brand name ones when these are done.

They work but must be replaced often. I don’t know if it’s better to buy the more expensive razors that last longer or use these. It’s a preference thing for sure. There are only 3 blades so I assume they wear out quickly. I actually didn’t mean to purchase but figured I’d give it a shot
for the money it's just ok, I rate it way below the Big Brand. there is no trimmer on back of razor. The handle is cheaply made.. You get what you pay for

After using five cartridges, I'm having to completely re-do my review, because I'm very disappointed. The first cartridge, which came already installed on the handle, was of stellar quality, delivering excellent shaves for more than two months, inspiring a five-star review, which I have now been forced to erase. Every subsequent cartridge has varied somewhere between mediocre and miserable. Two of them actually started out duller than the ones they replaced were at the end of their run, which is simply unacceptable. I have fifteen more cartridges left, but I'm not sure I want to subject my skin to them. One thing's for sure. I won't be buying these again.
Good shave for the cost
The two blades seem dull and don't cut as skin smooth as I'd like.  It's a good price and handle send strong. B

While I'm aware I have coarse facial hair, these blades last about 2 shaves for me. That's not too good. Gillette blades (while more expensive) last at least 5 shaves for me. That gives you an idea for comparison. These blades are a good deal, but don't expect to much from them if you have coarse facial hair.

reviewTitle: not even close to Gilette. worst blades
reviewDescription: Worst shave. i need to go over my face 4 times just to match what my /trac 3 Gilette does in one movement. The money that is saved is not worth the pain. Dont buy it

reviewTitle: Check if it will fit your razor handle
reviewDescription: was not explained that the only razor to fit these blades was not gillette or schick. In fact these blades fit nothing I have. I am not inclined to spend additional money on this prodouct.
This thing is straight garbage. It’s impossible to set another blade on it. Trash.
Maybe the worst razor blades I’ve used in years, maybe since the safety razor when I was a kid. Amazon is usually the best but they need to check into these. Threw them away after two tries.
THIS IS NOT A GOOD RAZER ADVERTISED AS 3 BLADES ONLY HAS 2

reviewTitle: Better to cut it with a butter knife
reviewDescription: I just tried these blades cut worse than using my dull bic blade. Don’t waste your cash  just to get a rash.
Cheap garbage and they sent it out knowing it’s junk refused to fix make you jump thru loops  beware with Amazon brand

The product came in as described but these are the most pathetic blades I've ever used. I rarely review my purchases but needed to say something about this one.I ordered these because it seemed to be an amazing deal and I've always had good experiences with Amazon Basics products. The handle looks and feels fine but I go through 2-3 of the blades per shave. I've somehow gotten razor burn every single time I've used these. It's possible that I somehow just got a garbage batch or something like that but I'm definitely disappointed.Taking recommendations on decent, affordable blades!

I really don’t review products, but this deserves public awareness. They are almost completely useless. Somehow you can use them to shave and then you’ll look yourself in the mirror and it doesn’t look like you’ve shaved at all.
It’s not a Mach-3 quality replacement.

reviewTitle: Not a close shave at all
reviewDescription: First the handle is a pain to attach to the blades. I got past that only to have the shave no where near to close. A total waste of money.

reviewTitle: Item does not work with Mach 3 razors
reviewDescription: This item is either falsely labeled or someone does not understand what the Mach 3 product looks like. These cartridges in no way, shape, or form are able to attach to the Mach 3 razor. The socket does not match Gillette products. I was able to easily get a refund, but look elsewhere if you are considering buying off brand, or just buy Gillette's refillable razors.

This quality, construction of this blade is excellent. The biggest flaw is that the blades are so closely placed that the hair gets stuck and we constantly need to rinse, re rinse (waste of time and water)The other thing is the blades are mounted towards inside therefore it doesn't make good contact with skin and you need to run the blade several times in order to get a clean shave which still leaves patches here and there.ALL THESE ISSUES DON'T EXIST IN THE GILLETTE MACH 3.Therefore going back to expensive mach3 unless this manufacturer addresses these issues.
I have never had such an uncomfortable shave as I experienced with this razor
Don’t buy.  Impossible to reload blade.  Not nearly as smooth as Gillette
These are terrible, they pull on your face, not sharp at all!
Cheap cheaper cheapest.Difficult to snap blade. Blade comes off easily.  Not a clean shave. You get what you pay for.  Staying away from the 3 blade. Junk

I’ve tried several brands of razors recently because the three bladed brand I’ve been using for 25 years now costs nearly $10 a week to shave. I’ve used several of amazon branded products now. Some are really good, some aren’t, but these were, in my opinion, the worst of amazon brand products I’ve tried. These are the worst of the razors I’ve tried recently. They scrape me. They feel like razor blades did before the 3-blade ones came out in the 90s.

Got tired of paying loads of money for the Gillette Mach 3 blades, so figured these blades would be a affordable alternative. Not even close! These are the worst blades I've used. They were dull and did not glide smoothly over my face. My worn Gillette blade finished my shave with a closer cut. Going back to the pricy Mach 3 blades. At least they work!

So I tried switching from Gillette in hopes this would be more economical and let me say…don’t do it!!! Horrible razor burn it’s not smooth at all and you’ll end up regretting ever switching just to save a few bucks.
I've tried them all and this is bar far the best razor I've owned. After owning single blade disposables, double-edged, double, triple, and 5 bladed razors....this one stands alone.

I have been looking a inexpensive alternative to the pricy brand names , i have tried many different razors but this one really does the job . I have been using the same cartridge 3 weeks and in still works good . Many times i need a quick shake with out soap or lather and it still works good . I'm sold .

I bought the 3 blade razors. I am bald so I do a bit of shaving and I am pleasantly surprised with this set. Works very well and the blades last longer than I expected. I seem to always have an issue rinsing the 5 or more blade systems but these rinse well.Planning on purchasing again.

reviewTitle: Sure works as good as Gillete & much better price
reviewDescription: Does a nice clean shave & price is right! The only proble was getting the blade cover off
Always gives a smooth, cut with no issues and the blades last a long time

They are sharp and stay sharp for a long time. I have yet to cut myself. Absolutely the best I have used at a fair price. The handle is sturdy and well made. You will not be disappointed. Much better than the name brands.
An efficient product at a very good price!

My husband had been looking for replacement blades for his razor that he had for a long time and the store quit carrying them, so he looked for an affordable and effective replacement razor and decided on these. He told me that they were the best razors he's used in forever and better than the more expensive name brand stuff.

Well, I have been using this with the 3 blade cartridge.  I like the feel and I have not nicked myself in several shaves.  I have always had a problem with other brands with nicks. Great job guys!4 months now and still no knicks,  Took about a week to get used to the razor handle because it is a different design but shaving is great!  Thanks guys!

reviewTitle: Better than Gillette, With No Moral Lecturing
reviewDescription: I got tired of Gillette whining instead of trying to sell me a razor.  I tried these, and found they gave a better shave, with a more ergonomic grip, cheaper. It took a bit to get used to the cartridge mechanism, but it works fine.

reviewTitle: A good value triple blade razor
reviewDescription: I've used Mach3s for many years so I admit my bias.  I tried this razor because of the great value.  Functionally everything works well and I'll probably stick with it.  Three things I've noticed:  1) the blades are thinner and spaced much closer together versus the Mach3; this has the affect of requiring more pressure to get a close shave and you need wetter/thinner shaving creme on your face; 2) the angle of the blades is shallower versus the Mach3 which is another thing that makes getting that close shave just a little more difficult; and 3) the cassettes are very wide making it difficult to shave completely under your nose; I have to go back with a trimmer to get those last few hairs every time and it's annoying.It's a good value and you can get a decent shave with it but, though it may be safer for folks who don't have good technique or finesse, the Mach3 has a better blade design for a close shave.  For me the whole fancy swivel head thing is a pointless gimmick.  I'd be willing to pay a couple bucks more for a slightly better blade design.

reviewTitle: Bought these for my lady’s razor - FAIL!
reviewDescription: Ok.  I read a review where these are cheaper than the lady’s version, so I thought I’d give them a try.  Epic fail!  These do not even compare to the lady’s version of cartridge replacements!  I could shave without any shaving cream with the lady version.  The men’s feel like I’m dragging a piece of rubber along my leg!  After a few attempts to shave, I did decide to try with shaving cream.  They do a fine job with shaving cream, but I will not be buying these as a substitution again.
The the box says you're supposed to get 20 blades but only received 16. So where's the other four?
A bit heavy and not as good as the product it claims to replace …

Like: Packaging is straight-forward, and not difficult. Slip the razor handle into the new blade, click it out of the plastic holder, and now it's ready. Almost.Dislikes: it's not easy to tell this three-blade razor refill from other competing products, and which handle fits which blade refill. I bought other refills and handles, but only one handle fits this refill, and all handles look alike! So I now have a set of difficult handles and their "orphaned" refills, but none of the handles seem to fit the refills I bought for the Soligor handle. So it's a three-star rating overall, one for non-differentiation of the handles, and two for trying to please the customer.
Better than the 5 blade. Not as good as the mach 3.  Plucks hairs. Not worth the savings over the mach 3

reviewTitle: Spotty shave, handle also works with Solimo 5 blade carts though
reviewDescription: I want to give this razor credit for having a pretty satisfactory handle, and the expanded head motion (which wasn't a feature I was really looking for) seems to compliments my shaving technique well. Unfortunately despite those points I was still left with a rather choppy shave which was simply unacceptable to me. I'd say the problem is the blade spacing but it's not impossible that these carts simply aren't a good fit for me.This was also still better for me than the variety of cheap bic razors (which still cost more than this on Amazon) I tried out right before this, so if you're using something like a Comfort 3 or generic disposables and they're almost good enough for you then this might work out.  For the time being I've actually settled on the Solimo 5 blade carts (which this handle works with) and am reasonably satisfied with them for whatever that's worth...

Its a shame as I really liked them

The blade head pivots enough to fit all the contours of your face with ease.Not much else to say about these except give them a try and see for yourself.

reviewTitle: Smooth cartridge shave for near DE prices
reviewDescription: I've been shaving with a double-edge razor, brush and lather for years, because of the unbeatable prices of double-edge razor blades.  But of course, double-edge shaving takes lots of preparation, time and care in order get even a passably close shave without nicks and razor burn.  Cartridge razors are smoother, faster and easier, but prohibitively expensive.  Until now.I've used the Solimo three-blade twice now: once with my lather and mug, and once with just plain old soap.  Each time, I got a closer, smoother, faster shave than I could ever hope to get with my double-edge, with no risk of cuts.  And with cartridges at less than a $1 a piece, I can finally save time shaving without wasting a ton of money.The build quality and hand feel is, in my opinion, just as good as my old double-edge or the Gillette Mach 3.  The handle is substantial and heavy.Lastly, don't let the cult of double-edge shaving fool you.  It's utter nonsense that a double-edge razor gives you a "closer" shave than a well-engineered three-blade cartridge.  A double-edge is putting a bare razor blade against your skin and dragging: a cartridge keeps a steady angle, perfect depth and has lubrication strips on the top and bottom.  All the double-edge has going for it is nostalgia.  Sometimes, modern technology really does build a better mouse trap.  And Amazon built it for less.
5stars

reviewTitle: As good as Mach 3, maybe better..
reviewDescription: The Gillette Mach3 has been my standard razor for more than 10 years, but at (Costco's) price of $46.99 for 20 (and even when discounted are still about $38/20), I've been shopping for a substitute. The Kirkland 3-blade was pretty good, but would pull and catch when new. I've tried Schick, Bic, disposables, generics, and nothing could surpass the Mach3. Until I tried these Solimo 3-blade razors. $16.39 for 21 razors and a handle is less than 1/2 the Gillette price. And, I got a smooth shave with no nicks and no pulling or catching on my stiff and thick beard. The handle isn't bad, but has some exposed "chrome" that can be slick. I just needed to change my grip slightly. Do yourself a favor and give these a try.
Cut well highly recommend

Just purchased and could t be happier. Shave head/face daily and have used everything from Gillette Fusion, Schlick Hydro, DSC and Harry’s. These seems to blow them all away and at least half the cost. Handle has nice weight and great swivel in the cartridge head!

Well, so far I'm pretty impressed.I only shave with water while in the shower, and this razor handles that with no problems.  I know there are other people who say they cut themselves a lot with this...but I am guessing they do not know how to properly shave, were in a hurry, or were caught in an unfortunately timed earthquake.  Everybody's facial hair is different, of course, but as long as you go with the grain on the first pass, this thing performs like a champ.  Zero cuts, even without shaving cream.The handle is much bulkier than the Mach 3, which took a little getting used to, but arguably makes it easier to hold on to in wet environments like your shower, a Polynesian jungle, or the deck of your deep sea fishing vessel.There is not as much plastic around the blades as there is on a Mach 3, so it makes it much easier to shave in tight spots, like right under my nose.  It seems like a closer shave than the standard Mach 3, too.  It has been 24 hours since I last shaved and I just barely have stubble again.The only thing that remains to be seen, as far as I am concerned, is how long the blade lasts.  I shave, on average, every other day, and a cartridge from a Mach 3 will typically last about a month before I need to take out a bank loan to replace it.  Given how cheap these are, though- even if they do not last as long, they seem like a solid investment.I really do not think you can do wrong here.
