reviewTitle: Decent razor along similar lines as Gillette
reviewDescription: It's interesting to see the Solimo brand expand to include various products. I'm currently using a Gillette razor after my electric shaver finally bit the dust. With the Solimo brand, the look of the razor is pretty similar to the Gillette one.  With the three-blade razor, you can get a decent shave and while it won't win any awards. It will get the job done. I also used the Solimo five-blade razor and that was definitely a better shave as it caused a lot less cuts and left a smoother aftershave. This is of course with brand new blades so it will be interesting to see how the blades fare once they start getting older.

reviewTitle: Basic Blades, Better than Basic Handle
reviewDescription: I usually buy men's razors because they're much cheaper than those "pink" brands they make for us ladies. Cost wise, this Solimo 3 blade razor fits into that "bargain" category for me.Unfortunately, the blades are just basic blades, and I didn't find the shave particularly close or smooth. BUT the handle is great. It's easy to grip and stays put in your hand. It also pivots in a way that makes it easy to glide over knees and around ankles when shaving.Overall, I'd say this is an inexpensive basic razor with a handle that is better than basic.

For a three blade razor, this does very well. The blades rinse easily and don't clog between strokes. Handle is easy to hold and doesn't slip when wet. Pivots well around curves, and the lubricating strips do a really good job at preventing nicks. I find the current price of $6.49 to be cheaper than any name brand, non-disposable razor - you get two blades and the handle. There is a $1.00 off coupon to make it a little easier on the pocketbook. The refill package is a good value at $9.89 for 8 razors. For those of you who belong to a shave club, this really rivals it's membership prices.

As others have noted, in comparison to the Mach3, the blades are a lot closer together.  This means they get clogged with shaving cream and hair a lot faster and take longer to wash out between strokes.  Shaving with the Solimo will take longer and use twice as much water.  And this only gets worse as the blades begin to dull.  You go through these a lot faster than Mach3 blades.  I switched back to Mach3 after trying these for a month.  Also, it's a matter of taste, but I'm personally not a fan of the larger handle and head.

reviewTitle: Well made, but don't cut close enough for me.
reviewDescription: I like them and they are a good value.  I wish they cut a little closer.

I like the handle, but the blades are trash! I'm so glad I didn't order more than the two the handle came with. They were dull right out of the package and pulled hair as if it had been used. I know it hadn't, but I really hate that I can't find any cartridges that are compatible with the handle, but with quality blades.

The handle is easy to grip and has some weight which I love however the blades themself rust within a week and get dull very very fast I should have stuck to Gillette it may be more expensive for the blades but I can use one blade for a couple months versus a week however these blades are a lot smoother and give less razor burn and bumps then the Gillette razor

The blades just don't seem to be as sharp as others I've tried. I have normal shaving needs not some heavy beard growth and the blades pull hard and scrape more than cut. All kinds were tried with the same shaving cream.

Update: The three blade razors work really good (5 star for them but still a zero for 5 blade).Razor came with two three blades and 10 five blades. Have not tried the three blades. The five blades are horrible. I do not have a sensitive head but these things tore me up. Tried twice with same results. Will they the three blades but will likely go back to my Gillett mach 3.

I usually shave with a 2 blade razors, but it's almost impossible to find replacement cartridges so I thought I'd give this 3 razor a try. After about 4 shaves I realized that it does not shave as well as my 2 blade razors. It seems to float over my skin whereas I can actually feel the razor when I use my 2 blade, and I have better control and able to get into tight areas .This is a bargain but I'll stick to my 2 blade razor .

reviewTitle: Easy to use but I think I'll stick to 5 blades
reviewDescription: I plan to return these and get the 5 blade set instead. The 3 blade set just didn't cut it for me, literally... If you find yourself sliding your razor over the same patch of skin too many times then you might want to try different styles of razor blades or a razor with more blades.
Not ergonomic. Difficult to hold in the proper position. Three blades are too many for me but may work for others. I've tried to get used to them but it just doesn't feel right.

reviewTitle: Seems to shave well, but good luck getting near your nose
reviewDescription: There is so much material above and below the blades that is is pretty difficult to shave the upper lip and get close to one's nose. Also, at some angles I found that I was only scraping the lubricant or the rubber part against my skin, not the blades.
Workable product provided a comfortable shave but has no trimming blade and is far outclassed by Pace razors.

reviewTitle: Really have to work for a close shave.
reviewDescription: Pretty much like all others.
Just ok - not really that good - comparedTo Discount razors at drugstores
For whatever reason don’t last as long as my other brand.
Blades are sharp, but I feel the cartridges could use more lubrication to prevent razor burn.

reviewTitle: just not that good of blades
reviewDescription: blades are not that good. not sharp.
These don’t do nearly as well as the five blade cartridges.  5 blades are excellent.
Typical cheap semi disposable razor

reviewTitle: Tried to give a detailed explanation. , unfortunately I could not. . it sucks
reviewDescription: It a piece of crap
Does not give a close comfortable shave
they work. not as well as a good disposable. gave them away.
Well it doesn't matter return not a smooth shave at all
How it should be. a bit plasticy but works good
These are good, but I dont get the shave I was hoping for.  Good for the money.

These are the replacements for the generic Amazon Shaver. I decided 3 blades this order other than the 5 blade cartridges that came initially. There is a difference. The 3 blades don't last as long. I'm getting three shaves out the 3 blade other than several more with the five blade replacements. There are 12 total blades in this kit. Quality overall is excellent but sometimes tricky to load into the handle. I like the trays as you can save the used blades with the new blades. 3 stars overall!

reviewTitle: Not as good as Harry's Razors.
reviewDescription: I like the price, but have to make multiple passes to get a fairly clean shave, with no stubble.It will take some time to use all the blades. But I think I,ll be going back to Harry's

Will get the job done. Gave it to my high school son. I used it once, and once was enough. Rate it at the same level as the single use-throw away razors. The set should include more than one handle. The connection to the razor is thin plastic.

reviewTitle: Good, but not as good as Pace3.
reviewDescription: I have a razor in each two bathrooms, both have been equipped with Pace3 razors. When one Pace handle, stopped holding blades (it was over 10 years old), I saw these on sale and and used in one of the bathrooms. It gave me the opportunity to directly compare, as I alternate usage. The Amazon Basic is certainly able to give a good shave at a great price, however the Pace 3 is smoother, pulls a little less, and stays sharp longer.
Was excited for the packaging and price, but the shave is not great for my skin. It’s far too aggressive and burns easily. I have sensitive skin, so it may work for you, but it didn’t for me.

reviewTitle: Does not shave as well as my old Gillette sensor twin blade
reviewDescription: This is a well built quality piece but for my face, the shave is poor.
Best ones I've found,  swivels up/down left/right good quality

reviewTitle: This is a GREAT razor, but don't ditch the disposable razor you already have!
reviewDescription: So far, 37 great shaves with COLD water & Cremo Cooling shave cream. I'm an 80 year old retired white male and shave every 5 days.Consumer Advocate Clark Howard's website reports that he shaved for 1 entire year on a really cheap disposable razor.  He said the secret is to clean and dry the razor after each shave and store it in a dry place.  News Flash! Stainless steel does rust!  So..... BEFORE you trash the razor you have & switch to another brand, it's possible that ANY QUALITY disposable razor can deliver hundreds of shaves by cleaning, drying, and stropping now and then (see YouTube). If this works, you'll save a lot of money thanks to Clark Howard.I DO recommend Amazon 3 blade Basic disposable cartridge razor. The pivoting gimbal head keeps blades in perfect contact with contours of my face & neck.  I'll take meticulous care of the razor which includes using the back side of a regular leather belt to strop the blades a few times to sharpen the blades when necessary. YMMV.
This product beats the brand name one by a lot and works better.Excellent
This isn't complicated.  They work just as good as anyone else's, and, you're gonna throw em away just as often, for a lot less money! Keep it simple!

I’ve used these razors for years and they hold up well, last a while, and are super sharp.Pro tip: When you’re finished shaving, rinse and dry off your razor by smacking it against a hand towel. My razors last 2 weeks minimum using this method.
Works great.

I have tried too many different razors and blades.  I have settled on the Amazon 3 blade cartridge.  It is very easy and comfortable to use and does a good job.  I like it better than even the Amazon 5 blade.  I shave every day, and this is even economical.
Love the weight of the handle. The blade is very smooth and cut very well.

reviewTitle: 💖💓👍💪 FINALLY - Perfect Shaves w/o Costing me an 💪&🦵😋😋😋
reviewDescription: For years, if not decades, one of the most frustrating thing for a man is: why do we have to pay so much just to shave???? I mean the brand names like Gillette costs more than $3-5 PER cartridge, and then you got the Dollar Shave Club whom provides a slightly cheaper alternative but you're bound to a subscription model whether you need more replacement cartridges or not. Well, this dilemma might have been solved with my recent orders of Solimo 3-blade Shaving Kit.This kit comes with a Razor plus 20, YES - Count 'em, a whopping 20 additional 3-blade cartridges. This means each 3-blade cartridge is only costing me <$0.8, YES! It only costs me 80 CENTS! And you get the razor for free! Believe me, I never believe 4- or 5- blade cartridges shave any more effectively than the 3-blade counterpart! Yes, it definitely performs better than single blade razor, but once you reach 3- blade, anything more is just marketing, in my own personal experiences, they do not shave any better than THiS 3-blade Solomo Razor kit. And this razor + 3-blade cartridge kit shaves as good, if not better, than my previous experiences with Gillette, which I used to pay upwards of $20-$30 for a bundle, this 20-cartridge kit can last me at least 6 months, now shaving no longer needs to cost me an arm & a legForget brand Names which are extremely costly, while the subscription model alternatives are not very flexible, I highly recommend this kit to any man, you get perfect shaves every time, and save $$$$!🙏🙏🙏If you enjoy this review, please let me know 🤞🤞🤞💓💖👍💪 HIGHLY RECOMMENDED👍💪💓💖

reviewTitle: Just Want a Great Shave, Not a Lecture, and I Found It
reviewDescription: I was getting my razor blades, shave gel and post shave items from a subscription service.  It was convenient and the products were of generally high quality. Several months ago the email from the supplier became quite strongly political in a manner that did not agree with my political views.  I do not wish to look at myself in the mirror every morning knowing I am supporting a company that actively promotes views that disagree with my own strongly held beliefs. Therefore, I have changed my subscription to the Amazon Basics 3-Blade MotionSphere Razor and blades for Men which provides better quality than my previous blades and costs less.  I have also subscribed to Nivea Men Sensitive Shaving Skin Care Set, Sensitive Shave Gel and Sensitive Post Shave Balm, 2 Pack from Amazon, which are superior and less expensive than similar products from the former subscription service.I do not understand how a company can survive in business when their marketing practices offend approximately 50% of their potential customer base.Therefore, I am happy to have started two Amazon subscriptions which fully meet my needs at a lower price and do not push offensive political propaganda at me as a so called part of their service.

Price is great, but the razor has issues.Not a big fan of these blades as they tend not to shave very close. While the handle is nice the blades just do not feel sharp enough and they do not reach the ends of the cartridge.  Blades end an  1/8” from each end.  The cartridge itself is rather thick making it hard to shave close next to beard and mustache.

reviewTitle: They don’t seem to last long
reviewDescription: They don’t seem to last long.The blade that came in the razor felt like somebody had already used it before me. I won’t be buying these again
Decent razor, good alternative to the very expensive name brands.

Saved some money with these over the Mach 3. Was looking for a cheaper option. These are cheaper, but do not provide the one swipe and done. Around the blades is a little thick so I had some trouble getting around my ear and nose. It was nice on the head, but did not cut nearly as close as Mach3

I've used DSC for about 5 years and was happy with their product. Then along came COVID...Shipping became sporadic, and Customer Service became non-existent. For the price, these blades have performed adequately, but not on par with the "Big" players in the razor game. I may try the 5 Blade version before I give up on this product.

reviewTitle: The three blades are wider and closer together than my previous brand.
reviewDescription: The blades on this razor are about 4-5 mm wider than my last name brand blades. So you get a little more coverage. The blades are also closer together. This should help raise the hairs up for a closer shave. It also makes the blades get a little more clogged.  Certainly worth trying.
The razors are good. The glue used to keep the rubber on the handle attached degrades too fast and makes the handle sticky.

reviewTitle: They do the trick but not much more
reviewDescription: I like the three blade format which seems to be easier to use than the five blade. I never know how long they last. Sometimes 10 days, some other 4 weeks. I guess you get what you pay for...

I was hoping the blades would be as good as I am used to from Daily Shave Club but they are not.  Good enough to shave with but not super comfortable, a bit of pulling.  Does give a smooth shave so might be good enough for many guys.  The handle is perfect though.

I bought this item because reviews were good but either reviewers are paid or I received bad batch. First thing space between blades are to close therefore you have to press harder and few times more to shave properly, second blades doesn't keep  sharpness after few times.

I bought these for my husband because he wanted to save money on razor blades. It does NOT give a close shave at all. In addition, it pulled on his skin. He shaved with the gillette razor on one side of his face and this razor with the other side and what a noticeable difference.

reviewTitle: Many other good reviews but didn't work for me.
reviewDescription: Maybe my beard is too coarse for this cartridge razor.  Based on a lot of reviews this seems to work for some.  Performance was marginal with new blade.  After one or two shaves it was completely done.  The "silver lining" is that I changed to a DE "safety razor" and will never go back to any cartridge type.  Should have done that decades ago.  Superior performance and more cost effective.
Get the 5 blade.

The handle is great and feels well made.  The blades however, even brand new, offer a much worse shave than my 30 day old Schick. You get a lot of blades for the money, but unfortunately they're garbage. Will be paying a little extra for better blades.

reviewTitle: Attaching the handle to the blade is poorly designed
reviewDescription: These razors work ok once you can actually attach the handle to the blade. I have used Gillette mach three and dollar shave club razors and never had this much trouble attaching the handle to the blade.

reviewTitle: Just meh! not worth the few cents you save...
reviewDescription: I have a thick beard so... maybe i'm not a good judge... but wasn't happy giving them away.
I was a little disappointed in these. The blade refills are only good for one shave. I can get cheap razors that last a entire week

reviewTitle: Everyone is different, but doesn't deliver a close shave for me.
reviewDescription: After using it, I pick up the M3 blade to finish the job.  The handle is heavy and easy to use.  It also provides lots of lubrication, but it leaves a lot of rough stubble after using it.  If you drop the blade, the handle will separate from the blade but it is impossible to reattach unless its back in the plastic blade carriage.  The price is right and delivery is convenient, but I'll go back to using my previous M3 shaver.

reviewTitle: Good price, not a good shave
reviewDescription: It's obviously a good value, it's Amazon brand.  Unfortunately the shave isn't good...especially on the neck area.  It just can't get into certain spots.  Even on the cheek I have to go over the same spot multiple times.  TBH the disposable razors work better.

We thought we'd try saving money on expensive blade refills and bought these. Not worth it, the shave isn't nearly as close as the expensive blades (and you can't return these, so it ended up costing more to try to save). Didn't work well for either of us (male and female).There was also so much "vitamin e" on the blades that every time the blade was pulled away there was a slimy string from the blade to the skin. Gross.
a different feel from my previous razor, but not hard to get used to. seems to work well though. Gives a good shave, and definitely less expensive than the one I was using.

reviewTitle: Does the job well at an attractive price. A great combination!
reviewDescription: Shaving is a necessary activity. This shaving system gets the job done well without nicks and with acceptable comfort. The price beats that of its competitors by a long shot which was what drew me to try it. I will be back for refills when the time comes . . . but the shaving cartridges have a long working life. They could work on improving the cartridge attachment mechanism as I have continuing difficulty mounting the cartridge in the handle.

reviewTitle: The shaving cartridge could be slightly thinner
reviewDescription: Only product from amazon brands that I detectable noticeable though slight difference compared to comparable established brands.  The tip of the head is slightly too wide, and could be narrower.  It’s petty flaw though at compared to the Gillette version with one extra cartridge since I got additional 20 cartridges for twice the price at $15, but an easy permanent improvement to make indistinguishable the shaving experience.  Why not make these types of items available in local drug stores since most major drug stores like Walgreens, Duane Reades, and CVS have a membership card that could potentially discount more than regular price on Amazon.com.  I certainly don’t care about a brand of a shaver, as long as it shaves - it’s not like basketball or running shoes where the brand image might matter from being subject of social consciousness.  Why not add into Amazon Essentials regular soap bars also, since most houses probably still use soap, based on Google.com, over 250 million Americans still use soap bars.
Fine for the price. My dollar shave club blades from 10 years ago finally ran out, they felt sharper then these. But these are cheap.

Being a semi bald man, I shave my face regularly and my head about twice a week.  That's a lot of shaving over the course of the last 40 years.  The good news is we now have decent options when looking for cartridge razors.  When I first saw these, I was skeptical, but because of the cost, I decided to try them out.  I'm glad I did.  They're not the best razor I've ever used but they've been doing a very nice job for me.  And at about 1/2 the cost of some of the other brands I've used - that's good enough for me!
A little clucky
Can be a little rough but works fine.  Price is great however I've had had smother shaves.  Have bought on more than one occasion so that says it all.
Clean shave and doesn't cause me to have razor bumps

reviewTitle: as good as named brands for 1/2 price
reviewDescription: best value in a triple blade razor

reviewTitle: Love the 5 blade figured I’d try the 3
reviewDescription: I have used the 5 blade refills for some time with good success and have used other 3 blade systems with success so decided to give these a shot.  Value is there but I don’t find them as comfortable to use as other 3 blade systems and will likely purchase more of the 5 blades.  The 3 blade seems to be a little rougher on my face causing more ingrown hairs than a higher blade count, which is strange since the 5 blade tend to cut the hairs lower.
They are good
Like
Nice to find affordable razor and blades...

reviewTitle: Pretty good shave for reasonable money
reviewDescription: Shaving decent quality
It’s fine to use
They are good value, but I still prefer Gillette
My husband goes thru razors like crazy but these are a good price for what they are.  Will keep buying.

reviewTitle: Just like Mach 3– slightly larger head
reviewDescription: This worked just as well as the Gillette Mach 3 , and for much less money. The only real difference I noticed was that the head a slightly larger, so if you’re getting into *certain* areas, it can be a little bit trickier.

reviewTitle: Sad to say...the Mach 3 is still champ...
reviewDescription: It was a good try for Amazon to try to topple the 3 blade champ Mach 3 tho but it would seem they just removed the outer two blades from their 5 blade version and fell short in their aim. A tad more space between the blades would have made cleaning out the stubble MUCH more easier. The three blade version of Amazon's does NOT have the single trimmer blade  ( like the five blade version ) but would have been a nice touch to at least try to outdo the Mach 3. The price is better with the Amazon version and blade and shave quality are there, but to be king of the 3 blade shaver's, Amazon needs to make these two changes without changing the price and a NEW king of the hill will be born. But until they do...Mach 3 is the fairest in all the land!!!

Great razors. Not quite as smooth and nice as the blades I was getting from a shave club subscription, but also drastically cheaper. Much nicer than any disposables for sure. I got tired of paying for the higher cost blades. These will do just fine.
They are okay razors for the price.  Remember you get what you pay for.
Can’t beat the price, good performance

reviewTitle: Not Quite Fusion but Pretty Darn Good
reviewDescription: We were tired of paying the prices for the big name Fusion razor folks... you know the one so we gave these a try.These are not quite as sharp as those others but the difference in price makes doing a couple more swipes well worth it.I do wish they would make some without the gel strips for those with sensitive skin, but at least we have an alternative and they beat the heck out of the cheap disposable razors.
Nice razors great price. But would recommend getting the 5 blade over the 3. Still best razors I've come across for my skin.

This razor gives a decent shave and seems to be well made. The handle is very solid. The only negative I can find is that the little plastic blade guards (found on each blade) are very hard to pull off....I actually pulled the blade off the handle trying to remove the blade protector.I would buy these again.

Blades are very sharp and it shaves as well as any I have used.  They last about 50% longer than any other blades I have used.  The only downside is the handle.  The blades are a bit cumbersome to change, and difficult to hold at the right angle.  You have to "choke up" and hold the handle close to the head.  To be fare, there are small notches to hold on to, but still a bit strange
Not the same as a 5 blade razor but pretty close. Can usually go weeks without shaving and a 5 blade will whip my beard right off. 5-6 days and this razor struggles.  Great for daily shaving though.

I tried these blades over the Gillette, and I could say that I'm satisfied but I'm still wishing a little bit more from the razor, because it is losing its sharpness over a short time, considering that I'm not fully shaving, only outlining my beard. Regards to the price, you're taking and excellent tool home.
Works well cuts close
Single blade for shaping up not the best.
These razors are a lot better quality than I expected. They are sharp, durable and last for a few weeks. I shave daily so I run through razors like crazy. They have held up pretty well.
It loads the cartridge in easily and does a really good job on my face. I guess I would have a medium beard but, retired, and usually it is shaving at least a two day growth

reviewTitle: It left my skin dry and not smooth
reviewDescription: I did not like the way I t left my skin feeling, that’s th reason I purchased for sensitive skin.
Glides well and holds up against coarse hair. Not the absolute best I’ve ever had, but it hits all the bullet points and is a quality razor for the low price.
They don't stay sharp as long as some of the other brands I've used, but they are quite a bit cheaper too... over all, they are pretty good.
Not the best razor. Wouldn’t purchase again
I was a little worried, read some bad reviews, but so far no complaints. I’ve used them for a month, a descent shave 🪒 in my opinion.
Good razor, shaves nice and close, very smooth.  Would give it five stars if it had a top blade for close in trimming.
Not bad for knockoffs I usually use Mach 3 blades, these are very close but for the price you can’t beat em

reviewTitle: Spend a little more and buy the FIVE blade razors.
reviewDescription: Good value for the money.  Did not give me the closer shave I can get with a five blade razor, so think I will go back to a five blade razor after I use up this three blade razors.
Muy buena afeita perfecto
Great razor for the price. I had already purchased the 5 blade razor and that one is even better.
Have bought these razors for months now. Works good good price.

I bought these razors for my Mach 3 handle. Unfortunately the razors were not compatible with my handle. I wound up purchasing the Amazon basic handle which are compatible with these razors. All in all it’s a great purchase.

So far I find there superior than the five blade version.  My beard is not so heavy but I look grungy if I do not shave daily. The five blade version does real well day 1 and declines rapidly even though I clean it out daily. They just do not last too well, planned obsolescence. The three blade version does a good enough job for me but seem to be more durable.  I prefer getting more uses out of a blade than the 5 blade was providing me.

reviewTitle: Best value for three blade razor
reviewDescription: I highly recommend these three blade Mach 3  style razors. They don't last quite as longas the name brands, but the value makes up it . For the most part, they shave just like the name brands don't waste your money on Harry's or Gillette buy these razors
Great razors and great price

I have always used Gillette brand razors and was hesitant to try these. I only use them to shave my head, not my face so this review is solely based on head shaving.The price on these was great in comparison to the bigger brand names. The razors shave nice and I cannot say I notice any major difference in the shave when comparing to Gillette brand. The handle feels similar to the Gillette fusion razor handle. I have now used these razors a few times, even once after not having shaved my head in 4 days. I am still using the same razor as well, I usually use the same one a few times before switching it out.

reviewTitle: good -- but not the best feeling razor on your face
reviewDescription: had other Amazo razors -- that were a more comfortable shave - but for the $$$ these are good

reviewTitle: Incredible value if you can purchase them at the Amazon Fresh price
reviewDescription: I live in the Seattle area and through Amazon Fresh, the price is $6 for the 12 cartridges which is an incredible deal. Otherwise, I don't think that they're worth the $17 list price. But, if you are paying $6, you won't find a comparable product at that price. I mainly use this for my legs but have also used it on my arms, pits, chest, and nethers which the blades had no issue with. For my legs, I was able to get three comfortable shaves out of one cartridge.

I am on the Subscribe and Save program for these replacement blades.  My daughter, husband and I use them.  They give a nice smooth shave.  My husband is very happy with them since he shaves daily.  My daughter and I prefer these over the woman's blades for the Solimo razor handle.
Works great well balanced easy to shave with great value for money I believe it came with 10 good sharp blades. LOVE IT!
They don't last as long as name brands but even with that they are cheaper and a better deal
I took away a star because the newest blades do not have the trimmer on the one side to get your sideburns. I still love the razor though.

Best weighted and ergonomic handle of any shaver for me.  Used with 3-blade cartridges.  Very good shave but blades dull quicker than my old standby shaver.  Also there are better values with competitors.
I really like this set. It's cheap and the razor and blades are well worth the money.

reviewTitle: Just as good as the more expensive brands
reviewDescription: I’ve used these for yearsThey are sharp and durableI’ve avoided the big make razors for years because these are great

reviewTitle: Why did they go from $5.99 to $19.39 for 12 pack in less than 2 weeks?
reviewDescription: Blades are pretty good and better than Gillette blades.  I am wondering why did they go from $5.99 to $19.39 for 12 pack in less than 2 weeks?
I like the value.

Pretty damn good razor. Trying to get away from Gillette I tried several different ones and none of them measured up to Mach 3 until I tried these.I love the extra weight the handle has and you can't beat the price of the refills either. Lasts me about four shaves before I change the cartridge.

Wow, I'm happy to have these blades for less than $1 per blade. Compared to my old Gillette blades that cost 4X that, these Solimo 3-blade cartridges deliver about 90% of the Gillette experience. I take 10% off the experience because there is no blade on the back for sideburn work, and there is an excessive amount of sticky gel left on my face - even after my fourth use of one cartridge.
This razor gives a good shave.  Price point beats all competitors in it's class.

reviewTitle: Works well but a little bulky
reviewDescription: A good value and shaves close without irritation. Only issue is that it’s rather bulky and heavy. Blades last about the same as the 3-bladed Gillette and cost less.
These blades provided a pretty close shave and didn't cause any nicks or cuts.  I would prefer a closer shave, but for the money they did pretty well.

So happy not to finance the woke clowns at P&G. This product is pretty good. The Personna is the only thing better, but since the above mentioned bozos changed the Mach 3 handle, this is the only alternative unless you have some old Mach 3 handles lying around.
These blades are just as good as the Gillette Brand and cost more then half the price. I`ll purchase and use the Solimo blades over Gillette razors from now on.

I switched back to the three bladed version because I can't shave under my nose with the 5 bladed ones due to depth of plastic between  top of plastic and first blade. Blades are as sharp as Gillette but harder to use

Recently bought this razor because of the ridiculous price of the name brand blades in my local store. It's my first time using a razor with 5 blades and it seems somewhat overkill to me but I was happy to see the the 3 blade refills I purchased also fit this razor handle so I'm all set for a few months. The handle has some heft to it and makes shaving very comfortable.
difficult to change razors and handles feels cheap

Great razor and blades for the price. They might not last quite as long as the expensive name brand, but it is pretty close, and at a fraction of the price. I have purchased this twice and will continue to do so if the price remains this low. You really can't beat the value.

reviewTitle: The 3 blade did not give me a smooth shave.
reviewDescription: The 3 blade did not give me a smooth shave on the first pass as I'm am accustomed to. I'm going to try the 5 blade. Shaver handle is easy to control and pivots as it should.

The price is great, better than Harry's not quite as good as gillette but for money I think it's a great deal. The razor itself doesn't feel cheap shave isn't bad, but not as close of a shave is the Gillette razor.I will buy this brand again!

Under what I consider normal usage the blades performance is average. I usually have to go back and touch up areas around my chin and sides of my face. Although it is a bit inconvenient I have no plans on switching to another razor brand. The price to quality is more than acceptable for me.

Amazon seems to be doing a pretty good job with their Solimo stuff and these razors are very good.  Kind of a weird construction with the gaps between the blades and the lube strips but you don't notice any difference.  The swivel head is kind of nice too.  Will buy again.
Not as good as Harry's which I was previously using but it was a great price and it doe's the job.

reviewTitle: Darn good for the price! Will purchase again.
reviewDescription: Love love love the price and less waste being thrown in the trash

I ordered the three blade razor and got five blade razor and refills in a three blade box some one stuffing boxes can't count. Update: Gave the five blades to my wife, she likes it. reordered and got the right product and am liking it shaves fine and great price.

No bells, no whistles, just a good quality 3-blade razor, priced well below the more famous competition. As I've gotten older, the need for more than 3 blades has faded and economy has become more important.  Used with Nivea shame cream, I get a close non-irritating shave. Recommended.

reviewTitle: Decent razor at a good price
reviewDescription: For the price it's a good item and does a good job
The blades are sharp enough and they're a great value. Handle is comfortable. Overall another rock solid amazon branded product.

reviewTitle: good value, hard to change blades
reviewDescription: Overall this is a great value and a nice razor. Changing blades can be a struggle sometimes. Smooth shave with good feel.
Great razor and much cheaper too. Definitely better than any disposables. I'm tired of paying for blades that cost more. .
Great razor. Not as smooth and nice as the blades I subscribe to from the shaving club, but also much cheaper.

For the price, these work very well.  They are comfortable and the blades have lasted many shaves (7-10 each).  I was previously using an old Gillette razor, and the replacement blades were only good for 2 shaves, so these are a much better value.  My only gripe (and why 4 stars) is that the razor head shape makes it difficult to shave under my nose.  Would need the blades to be slightly higher on the head.  A quick "touch-up" with the electric after I'm done is all it takes to have a perfect shave.  Recommended.
Handle is good for the price. Razors not good for sensitive skin
Good value for money

The blades give a close enough shave for me.  A little less close in the thicker beard areas, but close enough, I mean how close does it have to be as long as it is  acceptable , and it is.  Mach 3's last me about 3 shaves before they get useless, these will last me 6-7 so that is a bonus.  I don't find them irritating at all.  I had to find the correct handle angle to get the closest shave.  A down-side for me is I have to really maneuver it to get underneath my nose, it seems that the distance between the blade edge and the edge of the cartridge is pretty wide.  I will probably buy these again.

For the most part they work well. There have been a couple that were either dull or the guard was simply too thick. I will continue to purchase as long as I don't recurve an entire set that are unusable. They do last as long if not longer than higher priced razors!!
Articulates ok but the steel blades are cheap and rough.  Doesn’t give a clean smooth shave like it should.
I love the way it shaves. I shave my face as well as my head. But I don’t have sensitive skin

reviewTitle: Good quality disposable razor, great value for money.
reviewDescription: Seems to be a very good blade. I have a beard and only use a razor to clean up the edges but so far the blades have lasted several clean up sessions without dulling. Cuts as clean as any Gillette blade at 4x the price.
Even if I only use each cartridge a few times, these are a value.  I like Jeremy’s razors as well, these were bought to test out.
the feel

This men's razor is a game-changer. The precision of the blades ensures a smooth, close shave every time. The ergonomic handle provides a comfortable grip, making the shaving experience effortless. It navigates contours seamlessly, leaving no stray hairs behind. Durability and a sleek design make it a top-notch choice for grooming. Highly satisfied with the performance.

I used Dollar Shave Club for years. But when they kept hiking their prices and the handles broke when dropped, I looked for alternatives. This is the one I settled on.The handle is sturdy and the blades provide a close shave. This is a great value, relatively. I change out blades weekly and shave daily.
As sharp a Gillette Mach 3 but I don't get as many shaves. Still they are worth the price.

reviewTitle: Why are these so much better than Gillette?
reviewDescription: The blades work so well I’ve given up on Gillette blades after 40 years of shaving. Over the years, I tried every variation of blade and settled on Gillette  but even with their advancements in handles and blades, they never got my face quite smooth enough. I’ve tried canned shaving cream, fancy brushes and lather, pastes, and oils. Oil comes closest.I originally ordered this brand by mistake, though they didn’t have the Amazon label. When I realized it, I figured I’d get a handle since they were cheap.I can’t believe the closeness of the shave and the smoothness it leaves behind.I have two problems with the product, which prevents me from giving a 5-star review: First, the handle really is cheap-it’s difficult to get the blade connected. And second, once you get it connected, it disconnects when trying to get it out of the blade holder. A coupe of times I set the razor down and the blade popped off and it is hell getting it reconnected.I might look at a new handle to see if that fixes my issue.
seem to shave as well the expensive brands I was buying. They last about the same time.
Affordable razor with blades that delivers a decent shave. Meets expectations. Always looking for a closer shave though.

I like these. They don’t last too long, and obviously don’t shave well when they’re starting to dull down, but they’re good. It might be because I don’t change the blade often enough. Maybe 1 blade per month is a good habit to have.The shave is smooth and fairly close. Reminds me of Gillette, but a little better in terms of smoothness. Gillette does last longer though. And Gillette does still shave decently when it’s dull.I’d still get these again. It’s basically a buck per month to have good shaving sessions. Try em out
One of the clasps broke as soon as I put the first blade on. Now I'm stuck with all these blades for a cheap junky razor I'll never repurchase. Seriously, Amazon; this is the best you could spew out?

reviewTitle: Use a switch blade for a better shave
reviewDescription: These are the worst razors I have ever tried! They scrape the skin off your face, the handle is even uncomfortable.I shaved once and will never use them again. Now I have to throw out 20 blades because THEY WILL NOT LET ME RETURN OR EXCHANGE THESE BRUTAL< DANGEROUS BLADES.

Not happy with these so far I finally ran out of my other razors I was using and started using this razor yesterday the very first time every time I use it it cuts my skin my face and other places that I shave.
They're unusable because they don't fit. I don't know what else to say.
Bulky awkward design and very dull blades. Couldn't get a smooth close shave. Dorco is wayyyy better.

Horrible waste of monies, will look elsewhwere.Packaged for overseas shipment that was hard to open, razor was not sharp,  handle hard to hold when wet , hard to hold unbalanced handleA rather cheap dollar store type item which is better not using..better off with a like product only different vendor. A reminder thst all Amazon products are not qualified to be good products...

After using my last Mach 3 blade SEVERAL shaves, to the point of intolerable dullness, I switched to this. It was duller new than the overused Mach 3.  Using this razor was very uncomfortable and left visible stubble. The next day I tried the second blade that came with this razor. Same bad shave. Then the thing went into the garbage.  A minus 5 rating would be about right.
Didn't work well at all
I have been using Dorco blades and ordered a set of these to compare. Unfortunately, these blades are unusable. I cannot get a close, smooth shave with them. Very disappointing product.
Poor shave quality, dulls very quickly
